description: Fundamental hand techniques delivering powerful, direct attacks with proper fist formation and body mechanics.

focusAreas: Proper fist formation and wrist alignment
safety: Always use proper fist formation to prevent injury
Use focus mitts or bags for power training

techniques.description: Basic punch with same-side arm and leg forward
techniques.detailedDescription: The fundamental punching technique where the punching arm is on the same side as the forward leg. Emphasizes basic power generation and alignment.
techniques.application: Basic attacking technique, foundation for all hand strikes, and building fundamental power mechanics.
steps: Assume walking stance with same-side leg forward
Form proper fist with thumb outside fingers
Extend arm straight from shoulder
Rotate fist to palm-down position at impact
Retract quickly to guarding position
commonMistakes: Punching from chest instead of shoulder

techniques.description: Powerful punch with opposite arm to forward leg
techniques.detailedDescription: A strong punching technique using the arm opposite to the forward leg, allowing for maximum hip rotation and power generation.
techniques.application: Primary power punch in patterns and sparring, utilizing full body rotation for maximum impact.
steps: Assume walking stance with one leg forward
Punch with arm opposite to forward leg
Rotate hips fully for power generation
Extend arm straight with proper alignment
Retract quickly while maintaining guard
commonMistakes: Poor timing of hip and arm coordination

techniques.description: Standard punch using front two knuckles as striking surface
techniques.detailedDescription: The classic punching technique using the first two knuckles as primary striking surface, with proper fist alignment and wrist position.
techniques.application: Versatile punching technique for various targets, foundation for all fist-based attacks.
steps: Form tight fist with knuckles aligned
Position wrist straight and strong
Extend arm with knuckles facing target
Make contact with first two knuckles
Retract along same path to ready position

techniques.description: Simultaneous double punch with vertical fist alignment
techniques.detailedDescription: An advanced punching technique delivering two simultaneous punches with fists in vertical alignment, requiring coordination and balance.
techniques.application: Powerful double attack, breaking techniques, and demonstrating advanced punching control.
steps: Assume stable stance for double power generation
Form both fists in vertical position
Execute simultaneous punches to same target
Maintain balance and alignment during double extension
Retract both arms simultaneously
commonMistakes: Loss of form with simultaneous action

techniques.description: Double punch delivered in upward motion from low position
techniques.detailedDescription: A sophisticated double punching technique executed in upward motion, starting from low position and rising to target.
techniques.application: Attacking from low positions, countering against taller opponents, and combination techniques.
steps: Start from low or crouching position
Execute double punch in upward arc motion
Coordinate both arms in synchronized upward movement
Strike with upward penetrating force
Return to ready position
commonMistakes: Loss of balance during upward motion

techniques.description: Punch delivered at specific angles rather than straight line
techniques.detailedDescription: An advanced punching technique executed at precise angles, requiring understanding of geometry and targeting in combat situations.
techniques.application: Attacking around guards, hitting specific angles, and advanced sparring techniques.
steps: Identify specific angle of attack
Adjust body alignment for angular delivery
Execute punch along precise angular path
Maintain power despite non-linear motion
Recover to defensive position
commonMistakes: Loss of power in angular delivery
Poor body alignment for specific angle
